newsitem.title: CHINA: Floods affect China plant's zinc output.
newsitem.headline: Floods affect China plant's zinc output.

text.p: The summer floods in central and southwestern China have affected output at a major zinc plant in Liuzhou in southern Guangxi province, company officials said on Thursday.
More than 90 percent of the Liuzhou Zinc Factory grounds were flooded. Between 7,000 and 8,000 tonnes of zinc in the factory's warehouse was also affected, the official said.
"One of our production lines at the site is still being repaired and is expected to start operation in October," he said.
"The floods will have some impact on our output this year," he said, without giving further details.
Flooding was particularly bad in Liuzhou where much of the city was affected.
The Liuzhou plant accounts for almost 20 percent of China's total zinc output, the official said, though he declined to give precise figures of the plant's capacity.
China's zinc output in the first seven months of this year was 595,400 tonnes, down 5.16 percent from the same period of last year.
